ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] possible bug in Heritrix.java in 	Heritrix2-trunk

Thank you very much for your help.
I mixed heritrix-2.0.2 and trunk classpa=
ths.
Now it works.
Thanks also for making me realize not to blindly trust j=
avadocs :)

Regards

Marco

2009/6/29 Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>:
>
=
>
> Hello Marco,
>
> In spite of what the javadoc says, version 1.1 of the =
commons-cli library
> supports retrieving options by their long names. The =
maven build config in
> commons/pom.xml calls for commons-cli 1.1.
>
> Is i=
t possible that you have your classpath configured in eclipse to point
> to=
 commons-cli 1.0?
>
> Noah
>
> Marco Fabbri wrote:
>> Hello,
>> I am trying=
 to integrate Heritrix in a new project.
>> I chose Heritrix2 because of th=
e new redesign.
>> First I tried version 2.0.2, but
>> http://webarchive.ji=
ra.com/browse/HER-1576 blocks a feature that I
>> need (max-bytes-download)=
.
>> So I did checkout from SVN, but then I encountered a problem at startu=
p.
>> Running inside Eclipse with the following startup params:
>>
>> -p 89=
99 -a xxxx
>>
>> the program exits with the following message:
>>
>> Unless=
 --no-web-ui is specified, you must specify an admin password
>> for the we=
b UI using --webui-admin.
>>
>>
>> Debugging the code I noticed that inside=
 the main method all hasOption
>> control parameters have been substituted =
with the long names (e.g.
>> line 223
>>
>> if (cl.hasOption('h')) {
>>
>> =
has become
>>
>> if (cl.hasOption("help")) {
>>
>> IMO this is not correct =
as hasOption param should be the short name as
>> stated in the javadoc
>>
=
>> http://commons.apache.org/cli/apidocs/org/apache/commons/cli/CommandLine=
.html#hasOption(java.lang.String)
>>
>> Going back to short names the progr=
am works correctly.
>>
>> Do you also think this is a bug?
>> If so, unless=
 you are planning to fix it soon I'll be happy to submit a
>> patch.
>>
>> =
Thank you for your attention and for your project which is great!
>>
>> Mar=
co
>>
>>
>
